bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George C. Beach, January 7, 1948

div1.p: Hench informs Beach that he is preparing a slide lecture on Reed to be delivered at the International Congress on Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George C. Beach, January 7, 1948
div1.opener:
January 7, 1948
1-582-097
General George C. Beach
Walter Reed General Hospital
Washington 25, D. C.
My dear General Beach:
div1.p:
Would you do me a favor? I am to give in
Washington in May before the International Congress
on Tropical Medicine, the “principal oration” on the
day when the Congress is honoring Walter Reed and
unveiling a statue of him to be placed in the Hall
of Fame. My lecture will be illustrated and I
want to include a slide of Walter Reed Hospital.

When I was stationed there briefly during
the war, I bought a post card showing an airplane
view of the whole center and I had a slide made of
it, but unfortunately it does not show up well. I
would appreciate it greatly if you would ask your
secretary to send me a photograph of the Walter
Reed Hospital that I could have reproduced, and I
should think that a colored penny post card would
be quite adequate. I enclose a stamp which she
may use and realize that its enclosure does not
begin to cover my obligation for this favor.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
Enclosure
